ai_summary: Add optional tags field to Pomodoro sessions and time-tracking entries for activity categorization and analytics
notes: Feature request to allow users to categorize Pomodoro and time-tracking sessions with optional tags (e.g., #learning, #writing). The codebase is well-positioned for this: (1) Task tags infrastructure already exists with string[] arrays, (2) TimeEntry already has description field - could be extended with tags, (3) TimeTrackingController.getTimeSummary() already aggregates statistics by tags (lines 305-311) - this pattern can be replicated for Pomodoro, (4) PomodoroSession and PomodoroSessionHistory interfaces can be extended with optional tags?: string[] field, (5) FieldMapping system supports custom field names for daily note storage, (6) Tag filtering already exists in advanced filters with 'contains'/'does-not-contain' operators. Implementation follows established patterns and is backward compatible since tags field is optional.
suggested_fix: 1. Add tags?: string[] to PomodoroSession and PomodoroSessionHistory in types.ts (lines 577-611). 2. Update PomodoroService.startPomodoro() to accept optional tags parameter and store in session/history. 3. Add tag input field to PomodoroView (token-style selector near task selection). 4. Extend PomodoroController API endpoints to accept/return tags. 5. Update PomodoroStatsView to show tag-based analytics replicating TimeTrackingController's tagStats aggregation pattern. 6. Add pomodoroTags to FieldMapping for customizable daily note property names. 7. Optionally extend TimeEntry with tags array for time-tracking entries.
